definition[0]: to cover or fill a space or room with too many things, so that it looks very untidy
example[0]: Piles of books and papers cluttered his desk.
example[1]: The walls were cluttered with paintings and prints.
definition[1]: to fill your mind with a lot of different things
example[2]: the everyday tasks that clutter our lives
definition[2]: a large number of things that are scattered somewhere in an untidy way
example[3]: Could you get rid of some of that clutter in your bedroom?
example[4]: the clutter of soaps, shampoos, and towels in the bathroom
definition[3]: when there is so much information available that people cannot easily understand or remember it
example[5]: The company has moved most of its advertising to radio and print from television, saying that it wants to break out of the clutter.
